thesis.description: An attempt was made to present an interpretation of Berg's Sonata in the form of an orchestration of the piece. Inasmuch as a model for some procedures in suxh a transcription seemed useful. Berg's own orchestration of his Seven Early Songs was analyzed. This study revealed Berg's personal tendancies in choosing ensembles and in using instruments and instrumental groups. Berg's methods of underlining major structural events orchestrally, his use of progression in the rate of orchestral change, and his charcteristtically contrapuntal handling of textural details were also discussed. [...]
